intro: Espeletia santanderensis, commonly known as the Santanderan heather, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of Colombia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its rosette-like growth pattern and dense clusters of small, showy flowers. The plant is adapted to high-altitude environments, thriving in the dry, cold conditions of the páramo ecosystem. Its foliage is typically covered in a thick layer of fine, woolly hairs, which help insulate the plant from extreme temperatures. Espeletia santanderensis plays an important ecological role in its habitat by providing nectar for pollinators and contributing to soil stability.
